newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-CAGLIARI'S PANCARO APOLOGISES FOR SPITTING.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CAGLIARI'S PANCARO APOLOGISES FOR SPITTING.

text.p: Cagliari defender Giuseppe Pancaro apologised to Inter Milan's Gianluca Pagliuca on Friday for spitting in the former international goalkeeper's face during their Italian Cup tie on Thursday.
"We both insulted each other, I reacted and I want to apologise to Pagliuca for that," Pancaro told reporters.
"Everybody saw what I did on television. I was totally out of line," Pancaro added.
Pancaro was sent off in the 2-2 draw after the altercation in which the 'keeper appeared to butt him.
Seconds earlier Pancaro had pulled a goal back for Cagliari with an 85th-minute penalty.
Dario Silva equalised two minutes from time to complete a remarkable night for veteran coach Carlo Mazzone, in charge of his first game at Cagliari since the sacking of Gregorio Perez.
Mazzone said he had accepted Pancaro's apology but also pointed the finger at Pagliuca.

"Both (Pancaro and Pagliuca) were guilty of poorly representing this sport on television. I hope nothing like this happens again," the former Roma trainer told reporters. "They are ugly incidents that hurt soccer's image.
Pagliuca said on Friday he had been in the wrong as well.
"My reaction was definitely improper," he told reporters in Milan. "But nothing like that had ever happened to me. I think I would have preferred a punch in the face."
